text.__SUMMARY__: Rhododendron cyanocarpum is an evergreen shrub or small tree with leathery leaves and white or pink tinged flowers that are bell or funnel shaped. It is endemic to China (Sichuan and Yunnan) where it grows at altitudes of around to 3,000 to 4,000 metres.  It is threatened by habitat loss.
text.Sources: World Conservation Monitoring Centre (1998). "Rhododendron cyanocarpum". The IUCN Red List of Threatened Species. IUCN. 1998: e.T32448A9707763. doi:10.2305/IUCN.UK.1998.RLTS.T32448A9707763.en. Retrieved 16 December 2017.
